issue.title: PATCH call for symbol upload API should return accurate results

labels.name: diagnostics
labels.description: Related to App Center's Diagnostics service

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When following the [iOS Symbolication guide's App Center API steps](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/diagnostics/ios-symbolication#app-center-api), I thought the symbols were failing to upload because the JSON response returned `"file_size":0` and `"symbols_uploaded":[]` (As mentioned in #2051, the documentation didn't say there was a place to go to view the uploaded symbols - once I found that I discovered they were being uploaded after all).

This also makes it difficult to perform a validation that the correct symbols were uploaded. It would be nice if these values accurately returned the size of the zipped symbols and the list of dSYM files inside the zip.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
If the `file_size` or `symbols_uploaded` were left out altogether, the response would at least not be misleading or inaccurate.

**Additional context**
These are my requests and responses, with tokens redacted, PUT data truncated, and the final response body JSON formatted and commented:

### POST request

```
POST /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 52

{"symbol_type":"Apple","file_name":"some_dSYMS.zip”}
```

### POST response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:33:12 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 397
Connection: close
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express
access-control-allow-origin: *
access-control-allow-methods: GET, POST
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{"symbol_upload_id":"00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f","upload_url":"https://hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net:443/hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D","expiration_date":"2020-11-18T05:33:12.145Z”}
```

### PUT request

```
PUT /hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D HTTP/1.1
x-ms-blob-type: BlockBlob
Content-Type: application/zip
Host: hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 10779119

PK
âoQComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/UT	8»°_Á°_uxõPK
âoQ&ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ0ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ6ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK âoQ¹Í»_9¦AComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/ComickazeQLUT	8»°_8»°_uxõìÜy|LçâÇñAì-±Ç»¢¤Ö }ßCm5$E'É43!ÔÔN«©ZkWu¹Éµ×VT/­-riíMUUR½µÜ$ßÏÈ$¹¹¿Îë5¯ã}Îs¾óseæ$qúß¿>)l0ä+`0¥½Òþm8_Æðl©öòH{­Ðve×ZÍ7M5åo7½ÝsS¶çK/T¢^iK~¶<
]Õ
kåüî	ni¢ÓÂFß®Ã|
…
```

### PUT response

```
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Length: 0
Content-MD5: Mkz8TifLPEcFLWoWBZigAA==
Last-Modified: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:35:39 GMT
ETag: "0x8D88ABA9E2A8E46"
Server: Windows-Azure-Blob/1.0 Microsoft-HTTPAPI/2.0
x-ms-request-id: b47691b5-b01e-0099-06a3-bca561000000
x-ms-version: 2018-03-28
x-ms-request-server-encrypted: true
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:35:39 GMT
Connection: close
```

### PATCH request

```
PATCH /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads/00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 22

{"status":"committed”}
```

### PATCH response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:38:10 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 282
Connection: close
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express
access-control-allow-origin: *
access-control-allow-methods: GET, DELETE, PATCH
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{
    "symbol_upload_id": "00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f",
    "app_id": "78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199",
    "user": null,
    "status": "committed",
    "symbol_type": "Apple",

    /* Expected ["bundle 1.dSYM", "bundle 2.dSYM", "bundle 3.dSYM"] */
    "symbols_uploaded": [],

    "origin": "User",
    "file_name": "some_dSYMS.zip",

    /* Expected 10779119, matching the content size of the PUT request */
    "file_size": 0,

    "timestamp": "2020-11-17T05:38:10.355Z"
}
```

Duplicate of closed issue #2052)

issue.title: Not able to build XCFramework in Swift Package Manager with Mac Catalyst support
issue.body:
I tried to create XCFramework that support Mac Catalyst. But I can not. The XCFramework work fine on macOS and iOS, but not on Mac Catalyst. I tried by apple way and other lib that support (https://github.com/gurhub/surmagic) but only support iOS and macOS. ( I have tested on other frameworks)

There are no SPM supported, so I hope you could take a look. Thanks you.
![Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11 37 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32290683/183352370-d8489ec0-c003-43a8-925f-0fd2cef79cc6.png)

Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11.31.28

issue.title: Not able to build XCFramework in Swift Package Manager with Mac Catalyst support
issue.body:
I tried to create XCFramework that support Mac Catalyst. But I can not. The XCFramework work fine on macOS and iOS, but not on Mac Catalyst. I tried by apple way and other lib that support (https://github.com/gurhub/surmagic) but only support iOS and macOS. ( I have tested on other frameworks)

There are no SPM supported, so I hope you could take a look. Thanks you.
![Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11 37 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32290683/183352370-d8489ec0-c003-43a8-925f-0fd2cef79cc6.png)

Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11.31.28

comment.body: It looks like I misunderstood (As mentioned in #110). I see now when I try to check the Mac Catalyst box from the UnrarExample project (even without SPM in the mix) it won't run. I'll see what is going on. Meanwhile I'm going to close this issue as a duplicate and reopen the original one.

issue.title: Does not support Mac Catalyst
issue.body: Thanks for making a contribution to UnrarKit! I greatly value issue reports, which help make the library better, and more useful to more people. To help me address your issue, please follow the steps below. I have a project that need to run on Mac Catalyst. But UnrarKit seen like its cannot run on Mac Catalyst. I tried to use your example but this not working. Can you please take a look. Thanks you.

issue.title: Does not support Mac Catalyst
issue.body: Thanks for making a contribution to UnrarKit! I greatly value issue reports, which help make the library better, and more useful to more people. To help me address your issue, please follow the steps below. I have a project that need to run on Mac Catalyst. But UnrarKit seen like its cannot run on Mac Catalyst. I tried to use your example but this not working. Can you please take a look. Thanks you.

comment.body:
As I stated in Issue #109:

> Now I understand, thanks for clarifying. I'm going to close this as a duplicate of https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/issues/89, since UnrarKit doesn't support SPM yet. Please feel free to help get SPM integration working and submit a PR. I'd be happy to provide guidance, but I hit a wall when I tried. You can start from my [swiftpm branch](https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/tree/swiftpm), as mentioned before, where I started but didn't finish it.

It looks like I misunderstood. I see now when I try to check the Mac Catalyst box from the UnrarExample project (even without SPM in the mix) it won't run. I'll see what is going on. Meanwhile I'm going to close this issue as a duplicate and reopen the original one.

comment.body: Now I understand, thanks for clarifying. I'm going to close this as a duplicate of #89, since UnrarKit doesn't support SPM yet. Please feel free to help get SPM integration working and submit a PR. I'd be happy to provide guidance, but I hit a wall when I tried. You can start from my [swiftpm branch](https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/tree/swiftpm), as mentioned before, where I started but didn't finish it.

issue.title: XCFramework does not support Mac Catalyst
issue.body:
I tried to create XCFramework that support Mac Catalyst. But I can not. The XCFramework work fine on macOS and iOS, but not on Mac Catalyst. I tried by apple way and other lib that support (https://github.com/gurhub/surmagic) but only support iOS and macOS. ( I have tested on other frameworks)

There are no SPM supported, so I hope you could take a look. Thanks you.

comment.body: I've recently tried getting SPM to work with UnrarKit (see the [swiftpm branch](https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/tree/swiftpm)), but have had some trouble. Why do you need an "XCFramework" bundle? Could a regular .framework dynamic framework bundle work for you as well? I include one built with Carthage along with every release. There'll be a v2.11 beta out soon that should give you the latest and greatest code.

issue.title: PATCH call for symbol upload API should return accurate results

labels.name: diagnostics
labels.description: Related to App Center's Diagnostics service

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When following the [iOS Symbolication guide's App Center API steps](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/diagnostics/ios-symbolication#app-center-api), I thought the symbols were failing to upload because the JSON response returned `"file_size":0` and `"symbols_uploaded":[]` (As mentioned in #2051, the documentation didn't say there was a place to go to view the uploaded symbols - once I found that I discovered they were being uploaded after all).

This also makes it difficult to perform a validation that the correct symbols were uploaded. It would be nice if these values accurately returned the size of the zipped symbols and the list of dSYM files inside the zip.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
If the `file_size` or `symbols_uploaded` were left out altogether, the response would at least not be misleading or inaccurate.

**Additional context**
These are my requests and responses, with tokens redacted, PUT data truncated, and the final response body JSON formatted and commented:

### POST request

```
POST /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 52

{"symbol_type":"Apple","file_name":"some_dSYMS.zip”}
```

### POST response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:33:12 GMT

Content-Length: 397

{"symbol_upload_id":"00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f","upload_url":"https://hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net:443/hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D","expiration_date":"2020-11-18T05:33:12.145Z”}
```

Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express

access-control-allow-methods: GET, DELETE, PATCH
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{
    "symbol_upload_id": "00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f",
    "app_id": "78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199",
    "user": null,
    "status": "committed",
    "symbol_type": "Apple",

    /* Expected ["bundle 1.dSYM", "bundle 2.dSYM", "bundle 3.dSYM"] */
    "symbols_uploaded": [],

    "origin": "User",
    "file_name": "some_dSYMS.zip",

    /* Expected 10779119, matching the content size of the PUT request */
    "file_size": 0,

    "timestamp": "2020-11-17T05:38:10.355Z"
}
```

Duplicate of closed issue #2052)

labels.name: diagnostics
labels.description: Related to App Center's Diagnostics service

issue.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
When following the [iOS Symbolication guide's App Center API steps](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/appcenter/diagnostics/ios-symbolication#app-center-api), I thought the symbols were failing to upload because the JSON response returned `"file_size":0` and `"symbols_uploaded":[]` (As mentioned in #2051, the documentation didn't say there was a place to go to view the uploaded symbols - once I found that I discovered they were being uploaded after all).

This also makes it difficult to perform a validation that the correct symbols were uploaded. It would be nice if these values accurately returned the size of the zipped symbols and the list of dSYM files inside the zip.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
If the `file_size` or `symbols_uploaded` were left out altogether, the response would at least not be misleading or inaccurate.

**Additional context**
These are my requests and responses, with tokens redacted, PUT data truncated, and the final response body JSON formatted and commented:

### POST request

```
POST /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 52

{"symbol_type":"Apple","file_name":"some_dSYMS.zip”}
```

### POST response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:33:12 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 397
Connection: close
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express
access-control-allow-origin: *
access-control-allow-methods: GET, POST
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{"symbol_upload_id":"00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f","upload_url":"https://hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net:443/hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D","expiration_date":"2020-11-18T05:33:12.145Z”}
```

### PUT request

```
PUT /hwprodapp-78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199/upload-00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f?st=2020-11-17T05%3A18%3A12Z&se=2020-11-18T05%3A33%3A12Z&sp=w&sv=2018-03-28&sr=b&sig=NdBptJmXVXNC28ATfs1yi5KLMwRi8e71q0g1RvrHKx8%3D HTTP/1.1
x-ms-blob-type: BlockBlob
Content-Type: application/zip
Host: hogwartsprodsymbols02.blob.core.windows.net
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 10779119

PK
âoQComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/UT	8»°_Á°_uxõPK
âoQ&ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ0ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK
âoQ6ComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/UT	8»°_8»°_uxõPK âoQ¹Í»_9¦AComickazeQL.qlgenerator.dSYM/Contents/Resources/DWARF/ComickazeQLUT	8»°_8»°_uxõìÜy|LçâÇñAì-±Ç»¢¤Ö }ßCm5$E'É43!ÔÔN«©ZkWu¹Éµ×VT/­-riíMUUR½µÜ$ßÏÈ$¹¹¿Îë5¯ã}Îs¾óseæ$qúß¿>)l0ä+`0¥½Òþm8_Æðl©öòH{­Ðve×ZÍ7M5åo7½ÝsS¶çK/T¢^iK~¶<

…
```

### PUT response

```
HTTP/1.1 201 Created
Content-Length: 0
Content-MD5: Mkz8TifLPEcFLWoWBZigAA==
Last-Modified: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:35:39 GMT
ETag: "0x8D88ABA9E2A8E46"

```

### PATCH request

```
PATCH /v0.1/apps/Dov/Comickaze/symbol_uploads/00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f HTTP/1.1
accept: application/json
X-API-Token: 3798...e8f3
Content-Type: application/json
Host: api.appcenter.ms
Connection: close
User-Agent: Paw/3.2 (Macintosh; OS X/10.15.7) GCDHTTPRequest
Content-Length: 22

{"status":"committed”}
```

### PATCH response

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: nginx/1.15.10
Date: Tue, 17 Nov 2020 05:38:10 GMT
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: 282
Connection: close
Vary: Accept-Encoding
X-Powered-By: Express
access-control-allow-origin: *
access-control-allow-methods: GET, DELETE, PATCH
access-control-allow-headers: 
access-control-allow-credentials: false
access-control-max-age: 0
vary: Accept-Encoding
strict-transport-security: max-age=15724800; includeSubDomains

{
    "symbol_upload_id": "00565252-7207-1855-9c73-cc64e852db8f",
    "app_id": "78e98073-d049-4220-ab08-69103c188199",
    "user": null,
    "status": "committed",
    "symbol_type": "Apple",

    /* Expected ["bundle 1.dSYM", "bundle 2.dSYM", "bundle 3.dSYM"] */
    "symbols_uploaded": [],

    "origin": "User",
    "file_name": "some_dSYMS.zip",

    /* Expected 10779119, matching the content size of the PUT request */
    "file_size": 0,

    "timestamp": "2020-11-17T05:38:10.355Z"
}
```

Duplicate of closed issue #2052)

issue.title: Not able to build XCFramework in Swift Package Manager with Mac Catalyst support
issue.body:
I tried to create XCFramework that support Mac Catalyst. But I can not. The XCFramework work fine on macOS and iOS, but not on Mac Catalyst. I tried by apple way and other lib that support (https://github.com/gurhub/surmagic) but only support iOS and macOS. ( I have tested on other frameworks)

There are no SPM supported, so I hope you could take a look. Thanks you.
![Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11 37 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32290683/183352370-d8489ec0-c003-43a8-925f-0fd2cef79cc6.png)

Screen Shot 2022-08-08 at 11.31.28

comment.body: It looks like I misunderstood (As mentioned in #110). I see now when I try to check the Mac Catalyst box from the UnrarExample project (even without SPM in the mix) it won't run. I'll see what is going on. Meanwhile I'm going to close this issue as a duplicate and reopen the original one.

issue.title: Does not support Mac Catalyst
issue.body: Thanks for making a contribution to UnrarKit! I greatly value issue reports, which help make the library better, and more useful to more people. To help me address your issue, please follow the steps below. I have a project that need to run on Mac Catalyst. But UnrarKit seen like its cannot run on Mac Catalyst. I tried to use your example but this not working. Can you please take a look. Thanks you.

issue.title: Does not support Mac Catalyst
issue.body: Thanks for making a contribution to UnrarKit! I greatly value issue reports, which help make the library better, and more useful to more people. To help me address your issue, please follow the steps below. I have a project that need to run on Mac Catalyst. But UnrarKit seen like its cannot run on Mac Catalyst. I tried to use your example but this not working. Can you please take a look. Thanks you.

comment.body:
As I stated in Issue #109:

> Now I understand, thanks for clarifying. I'm going to close this as a duplicate of https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/issues/89, since UnrarKit doesn't support SPM yet. Please feel free to help get SPM integration working and submit a PR. I'd be happy to provide guidance, but I hit a wall when I tried. You can start from my [swiftpm branch](https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/tree/swiftpm), as mentioned before, where I started but didn't finish it.

It looks like I misunderstood. I see now when I try to check the Mac Catalyst box from the UnrarExample project (even without SPM in the mix) it won't run. I'll see what is going on. Meanwhile I'm going to close this issue as a duplicate and reopen the original one.

comment.body: Now I understand, thanks for clarifying. I'm going to close this as a duplicate of #89, since UnrarKit doesn't support SPM yet. Please feel free to help get SPM integration working and submit a PR. I'd be happy to provide guidance, but I hit a wall when I tried. You can start from my [swiftpm branch](https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/tree/swiftpm), as mentioned before, where I started but didn't finish it.

comment.body: I've recently tried getting SPM to work with UnrarKit (see the [swiftpm branch](https://github.com/abbeycode/UnrarKit/tree/swiftpm)), but have had some trouble. Why do you need an "XCFramework" bundle? Could a regular .framework dynamic framework bundle work for you as well? I include one built with Carthage along with every release. There'll be a v2.11 beta out soon that should give you the latest and greatest code.
